patient_information: Age: 51 years Sex: female Travel history: Swiss traveler returning from Guatemala and El Salvador
chief_complaint: Generalized slightly pruritic maculopapular rash on the face, trunk, and extremities; non-purulent bilateral conjunctivitis
history_of_present_illness: Six days after returning from a two-week holiday to Guatemala and El Salvador, the patient noticed a generalized slightly pruritic maculopapular rash on the face, trunk, and extremities. There was no fever and no other accompanying symptoms.
exposure_and_epidemiology: Travel details: Travel to Guatemala and El Salvador Symptom onset: Six days after return
physical_exam: Findings: ["Conjunctivitis", "Generalized maculopapular rash involving the face, trunk, and extremities", "Tender oedema of the hands, elbows, knees, and feet", "Generalized lymphadenopathy (cervical, axillary, inguinal)"]
labs_and_diagnostics: Full blood count: Normal Crp: 8 mg/L (<5) Creatinine: Very mildly elevated (87 μmol/L, range 35–80 μmol/L) Liver function tests: Normal
